text: What’s in a Word? Endorphin The word “endorphin” is an abbreviated version of “endo?enous morphine.” Morphine is a type of opiate. “Endogenous” refers to something that originates inside an or?anlsm. When endorphins interact with opiate receptors in your brain, your sense o faln is reduced and a feel n? of well-being is created, similar to the way morphine and codeine work.
